note.p: Burial Place: Parish church of Duntisbourne Abbots, Gloucestershire
Education: Glasgow University; Balliol College, Oxford; AB (1786, Oxon); MB (1786, Oxon); MD (1789, Oxon)

Career: Taught anatomy; Physician, St George's Hospital (1789); gave up lecturing and Physician's post to concentrate of medical practice, moving to Grosvenor Square; Physician Extraordinary to George III; wrote 'The morbid anatomy of some of the most important parts of the human body', (London 1793)
